Articles.Content:
So I am on of those guys that love mods, but only to add to the character of the game and make it more difficult. I run things like TAC, Remote Tech, Deadly Reentry, etc. When I run things like Near Future Tech, I take out the not yet realized propulsion, etc.

While I use things like Universal Storage, US items cost incredible amounts comparably so the added convenience, and often weight, justify the alternate version, hence they do not fail my "cheating" test.

So based on that, there is the quicky...

Are the Thor and Odin landers in NovaPunch cheating?

With the heatshield in the Thor, you get nice thrusters and decent fuel, especially considering the weight. Wondering if I should delete those.

Edited October 21, 2014 by Friend Bear

Not cheating, just good design. Now if it all weighed 1 ton and had 900000 units of fuel and 300000kn of thrust, yeah, that would be cheating. But the parts are not unrealistic and fit well in the game.
